bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
Pillow version 8.0.1 doesnt seem to satisfy the requirements of the package, even though there is no specific version numbered required. With Pillow 8.0.1 installed, attempting to pip install pytorch-lightning-bolts["extra"] will try to uninstall (downgrade) the Pillow version. Maybe placing a minimum pillow version requirement would fix this? <denchmark-code>> pip install pytorch-lightning-bolts["extra"]
Requirement already satisfied: Pillow in c:\users\simon\anaconda3\envs\pytorch\lib\site-packages (from pytorch-lightning-bolts[extra]) (8.0.1) Collecting Pillow Downloading Pillow-7.2.0-cp38-cp38-win_amd64.whl (2.1 MB)
Installing collected packages: pyglet, Pillow, pytorch-lightning-bolts, opencv-python, gym Attempting uninstall: Pillow Found existing installation: Pillow 8.0.1 Uninstalling Pillow-8.0.1: Successfully uninstalled Pillow-8.0.1 </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h3>To Reproduce</denchmark-h>
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
Install pytorch/lightning and Pillow 8.0.1 in a conda environment pip install pytorch-lightning-bolts["extra"]
<denchmark-h:h3>Environment</denchmark-h>
PyTorch Version (e.g., 1.0): 1.1.2 OS (e.g., Linux): Windows How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source): conda Python version: 3.8 CUDA/cuDNN version: 10.1
